sentences.en: Fear intensified during the interregnum between Herbert Hoover and Franklin D.
sentences.cn: 恐惧在胡佛和罗斯福任期的中间期得到加强.

sentences.en: He shared Clifford's concern about the interregnum.
sentences.cn: 他同克利福德对新旧总统的交替期都抱有忧虑.

sentences.en: No one in the interregnum seemed to feel final responsibility, and so matters drifted along.
sentences.cn: 在新旧总统交替期间,似乎谁也不愿意承担最后的责任, 于是事情就这样随波逐流下去了.

sentences.en: The Special Group itself was infected with interregnum uncertainties.
sentences.cn: 特别小组本身也受到新旧总统交替期间那种无所适从的影响.

words.tran_cn: 中断的；被打断的；不规则的
中断；空位期；过渡期；间歇

trans.tran_cn: （新旧王朝或新旧政府）更迭的政权空白期，过渡期，中断，停顿
trans.tran_en: a period of time when a country or organization has no ruler or leader, and they are waiting for a new one
